repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - First National Roads
            Improvement and Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First National Roads
            Improvement and Management Project for Philippines were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was high, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            cost and time overruns need to be reduced through improved
            procurement and contract management. The public's
            acceptance of road user charges and confidence in the Road
            Fund must be earned by the satisfactory utilization of funds
            applied in a consistent and transparent manner.
            Modernization of technical and business processes requires
            corresponding reforms at the organizational level in order
            to be sustainable. Policy change and restructuring at the
            sector level requires broad-based, strong client ownership
            at all levels of government. Governance issues and
            corruption are heavily influenced by both internal and
            external environments, so remedial measures need to be
            comprehensive and targets realistic.

docna.cdata!:
Philippines - First National Roads
            Improvement and Management Project

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - First National Roads
            Improvement and Management Project (NRIMP) : resettlement
            action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Roads Improvement Project
            aims at helping the Philippines achieve effective
            management, and financing of the national road networks.
            This Resettlement Action Plan includes the following
            principles: 1) acquisition of land and other assets, and
            resettlement will be minimized; 2) only those project
            affected people (PAPs) are eligible for compensation for
            lost assets; 3) replacement of residential, or agricultural
            lands will be allocated as close as possible to land lost,
            as acceptable to the PAPs; 4) PAPs losing all of their fixed
            assets, or partial losses, but where the remaining assets
            are determined by concerned authorities as not viable for
            continued use, will be entitled to full compensation at
            replacement costs; 5) in the case of PAPs' affected
            partial loss of land or structures, and where the remaining
            assets are viable for continued use, compensation for
            affected assets will be paid in cash; and, 6) the following
            modes of compensation are to be observed: a) compensation
            will be equivalent to the amount of materials, and labor to
            re-construct a similar structure for houses, or other fixed
            structures, but with deductions for salvaged materials; b)
            compensation at replacement costs for the loss of other
            fixed assets will be provided; and, c) compensation for land
            losses, will be provided with land of equivalent productive
            value at a location acceptable to the PAP, or if land is
            unavailable, payable in cash, at market values.

            management, and financing of the national road networks.
            This Resettlement Action Plan includes the following
            principles: 1) acquisition of land and other assets, and
            resettlement will be minimized; 2) only those project
            affected people (PAPs) are eligible for compensation for
            lost assets; 3) replacement of residential, or agricultural
            lands will be allocated as close as possible to land lost,
            as acceptable to the PAPs; 4) PAPs losing all of their fixed
            assets, or partial losses, but where the remaining assets
            are determined by concerned authorities as not viable for
            continued use, will be entitled to full compensation at
            replacement costs; 5) in the case of PAPs' affected
            partial loss of land or structures, and where the remaining
            assets are viable for continued use, compensation for
            affected assets will be paid in cash; and, 6) the following
            modes of compensation are to be observed: a) compensation
            will be equivalent to the amount of materials, and labor to
            re-construct a similar structure for houses, or other fixed
            structures, but with deductions for salvaged materials; b)
            compensation at replacement costs for the loss of other
            fixed assets will be provided; and, c) compensation for land
            losses, will be provided with land of equivalent productive
            value at a location acceptable to the PAP, or if land is
            unavailable, payable in cash, at market values.

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Roads Improvement Project
            aims at helping the Philippines achieve effective
            management, and financing of the national road networks.
            This Resettlement Action Plan includes the following
            principles: 1) acquisition of land and other assets, and
            resettlement will be minimized; 2) only those project
            affected people (PAPs) are eligible for compensation for
            lost assets; 3) replacement of residential, or agricultural
            lands will be allocated as close as possible to land lost,
            as acceptable to the PAPs; 4) PAPs losing all of their fixed
            assets, or partial losses, but where the remaining assets
            are determined by concerned authorities as not viable for
            continued use, will be entitled to full compensation at
            replacement costs; 5) in the case of PAPs' affected
            partial loss of land or structures, and where the remaining
            assets are viable for continued use, compensation for
            affected assets will be paid in cash; and, 6) the following

            will be equivalent to the amount of materials, and labor to
            re-construct a similar structure for houses, or other fixed
            structures, but with deductions for salvaged materials; b)

            value at a location acceptable to the PAP, or if land is
